meaning: New cycles born from endings; transformation.
proverbs: The night dies for the dawn to be born.
Out of darkness, light emerges.
verses: Oyeku Ogbe speaks: Every ending in the world is the seed of a new beginning.
Do not mourn what ends; celebrate what begins.

proverbs: The deepest well hides the purest water.
When all is hidden, the wise see beyond the veil.
verses: Oyeku Oyeku teaches: In silence and mystery, the truth reveals itself slowly.
To go within is to discover all that is unknown in the world.

proverbs: He who reflects conquers twice.
What is learned in the dark shines in the light.
verses: Oyeku Iwori says: Remain thoughtful in adversity, for wisdom is strongest there.
Offerings made in secret yield loud blessings.

proverbs: A closed door keeps sorrow inside and joy outside.
Not every ending is to be mourned; some protect.
verses: Oyeku Odi warns: Know what must end to preserve what is precious.
Build walls where wild winds blow.

meaning: Learning from past cycles, wisdom from change.
proverbs: Old fires warm the new traveler.
A wise person counts both blessings and lessons.
verses: Oyeku Irosun teaches: All cycles bring knowledge; cherish even the difficult turns.
From every error, gain a step towards completion.

meaning: Sudden shifts, hidden luck, embracing surprise.
proverbs: Sometimes fortune hides in uncertainty.
Thunder clarifies the air.
verses: Oyeku Owonrin reveals: Unexpected events are the ancestors’ riddles; learn to read them.
Let surprise teach you happiness.

meaning: Power of voice under restraint, silent leadership.
proverbs: The quiet drum is heard farthest in the heart.
Speak less, act more.
verses: Oyeku Obara says: Let your actions lead while your voice waits.
Lead not only by command, but by example.

meaning: Challenges out of nowhere, humility through reversal.
proverbs: Rivers change their course by force unseen.
Bend so you do not break.
verses: Oyeku Okanran counsels: Stay flexible as fate reverses direction.
Endure loss to discover your true path.

proverbs: When blocked, look for a new entrance.
A stranger sometimes brings the freshest water.
verses: Oyeku Ogunda teaches: Accept help from the unfamiliar to break through.
Call for aid when your arms tire.

proverbs: Not all snakes hiss.
Beware the silence that follows a storm.
verses: Oyeku Osa advises: Listen twice before trusting.
Danger cloaks itself in plain sight.

proverbs: Better to master yourself than conquer cities.
The steady hand guards the prize.
verses: Oyeku Ika says: Take control to keep your fortune.
Careful steps leave lasting tracks.

proverbs: The earth spins, never showing one face.
Blessings come disguised as hard work.
verses: Oyeku Oturupón says: Even failure hides a seed of renewal.
Return again and again until your effort bears fruit.

meaning: Spiritual wisdom, listening to the unseen.
proverbs: The wind prays in silence.
Guidance listens with closed eyes.
verses: Oyeku Otura teaches: Wisdom is heard not always spoken.
The path is marked by whispers and signs.

proverbs: Wealth gathers where spirit is respected.
Gratitude builds treasures untold.
verses: Oyeku Irete affirms: Prosperity is the reward of spiritual discipline.
Share and your blessings multiply.

proverbs: Tears water tomorrow’s growth.
Healing follows honesty.
verses: Oyeku Ose says: After what is lost, what is most needed arrives.
Let your wounds become wells of strength.

proverbs: The purest gold is tested by the hottest fire.
Fortune is the child of patience.
verses: Oyeku Ofun affirms: True destiny is revealed by testing and waiting.
Patience brings reward beyond expectation.
